Authors:
Sandra Nogal-Prata, Nitaro Maekawa, Toshinori Matozaki,
Margarita Duenas, M. Teresa Telleria, Maria P. Martin
Title:
Based on DNA sequences of ITS and rpb2, Amylostereum
orientale is reported for the first time to Japan
Keywords:
Amylostereum laevigatum, Basidiomycota, China, ITS nrDNA,
rpb2 gene
Abstract:
Amylostereum laevigatum has been reported from Japan
growing on Cryptomeria japonica and Chamaecyparis obtusa. Using
morphological and molecular data (ITS nrDNA and rpb2 markers), we
confirm that some specimens under A. laevigatum from Japan belong to A.
orientale, a species described from China. Amylostereum orientale
differs from A. laevigatum mainly in their smaller spores. This is the
first citation of A. orientale in Japan.
